note.p: Birth: Lyme Regis, Dorset, England (27 December 1851)
Education: Felsted School (1862-1867); Royal School of Mines
Career: Co-invented the process of making steel from phosphous iron, known as Thomas-Gilchrist process; Vice President, Iron and Steel Institute
Obituaries: Obituary Notices of Fellows of the Royal Society 1936-1938 vol 2 pp 19-24, plate, by H C H Carpenter
Notes: DNB gives death date as 15 December 1935
